title: Boy Scouts Insurer Chubb to Pay $800 Million in Sex-Abuse Compensation Deal
sub_head: An agreement with Chubb’s Century Indemnity would add to the funding available for sex-abuse victims under the Boy Scouts’ chapter 11 restructuring plan
body:
The Boy Scouts of America reached an $800 million settlement with Chubb Ltd. ’s Century Indemnity Co. over childhood sexual abuse within the youth group, which would boost the funds available for abuse survivors under its chapter 11 plan.
The proposed deal with Chubb is supported by a coalition of law firms representing the bulk of the roughly 82,200 men who filed claims in the Boy Scouts’ bankruptcy proceedings over past abuse.
